bullkpy.pp#

.. py:module:: bullkpy.pp

.. py:function:: qc_metrics(adata, *, layer=’counts’, mt_prefix=’MT-’, mt_var_key=None, detection_threshold=0.0, compute_total_counts=True, compute_n_genes=True, compute_pct_mt=True) :module: bullkpy.pp

Compute bulk QC metrics in adata.obs.

Smart behavior: - If layer looks like raw counts: compute total_counts, n_genes_detected, pct_counts_mt - If layer looks non-integer (log/normalized): compute only n_genes_detected using detection_threshold

.. py:function:: set_raw_counts(adata, *, layer=’counts’, overwrite=False) :module: bullkpy.pp

Store current adata.X into adata.layers[layer] as raw counts.

Call this once right after reading counts (before any normalization).

.. py:function:: normalize_cpm(adata, *, layer=’counts’, target_sum=1000000.0, out_layer=’cpm’, inplace_X=False, eps=1e-12) :module: bullkpy.pp

CPM normalize counts per sample.

:Parameters: * layer – Input layer. If None, uses adata.X. * target_sum – Scale factor (1e6 = CPM). * out_layer – Where to write normalized values (adata.layers[out_layer]). * inplace_X – If True, also write normalized values into adata.X. * eps – Small constant to avoid division by zero.

.. py:function:: log1p(adata, *, layer=’cpm’, out_layer=’log1p_cpm’, inplace_X=False) :module: bullkpy.pp

log1p-transform a layer (default: CPM) and store as a new layer.

Works with dense or sparse matrices.

.. py:function:: highly_variable_genes(adata, *, layer=’log1p_cpm’, n_top_genes=2000, n_bins=20, min_mean=0.0, max_mean=inf, min_disp=-inf, key_added=’highly_variable’) :module: bullkpy.pp

Select highly variable genes (bulk-friendly version of HVGs).

This computes mean and variance across samples on the chosen layer and identifies genes with high dispersion relative to genes of similar mean (mean-binned z-score of log-dispersion, Scanpy/Seurat spirit).

Stores results in adata.var: - mean, variance, dispersion, dispersion_norm - boolean flag adata.var[key_added] (default: ‘highly_variable’)

.. py:function:: filter_genes(adata, *, layer=’counts’, min_samples=3, min_expr=0.0, inplace=True) :module: bullkpy.pp

Filter genes by detection across samples.

A gene is “detected” in a sample if expression > min_expr in layer. Keeps genes detected in at least min_samples samples.

Works for counts (min_expr=0) or log layers (use e.g. min_expr=0.1).

.. py:function:: filter_samples(adata, *, min_genes=None, min_counts=None, max_pct_mt=None, max_pct_ribo=None, layer=’counts’, expr_threshold_for_genes=0.0, mt_var_key=None, ribo_var_key=None, inplace=True) :module: bullkpy.pp

Filter samples using QC metrics in adata.obs if present; otherwise compute from matrix.

No hard requirement that any of these columns exist: - total_counts - n_genes_detected - pct_counts_mt - pct_counts_ribo

If a requested threshold is provided but cannot be computed, it will be skipped with a warning.

.. py:function:: batch_correct_combat(adata, *, batch_key, layer=’log1p_cpm’, covariates=None, key_added=’combat’, overwrite=False, inplace=True) :module: bullkpy.pp

ComBat batch correction (Johnson et al.) for bulk expression.

.. rubric:: Notes

  • ComBat is intended for approximately Gaussian data: use log-transformed normalized expression (e.g., log1p_cpm), not raw counts.

  • Writes corrected matrix to adata.layers[key_added] by default.

:Parameters: * batch_key – adata.obs column with batch labels (categorical recommended). * layer – Which matrix to correct. If None, uses adata.X. * covariates – Optional adata.obs columns to include in the design (biological covariates to preserve). * key_added – Layer name to store corrected values (if overwrite=False). * overwrite – If True, write corrected values back into the selected layer / X. * inplace – If True, store results in adata; if False, return corrected matrix (samples x genes).

.. py:function:: sanitize_metadata(df, *, index_col=None, numeric_min_frac=0.9, category_max_unique=50, category_max_frac=0.2, datetime_min_frac=0.9, drop_high_cardinality_strings=False, high_cardinality_frac=0.5, verbose=True) :module: bullkpy.pp
